title: Mr Corbyn, the only way to safeguard worker rights in Britain is total escape from EU law
text:
“When it comes to workers' rights, the EU is not God,” dared blaspheme Labour's ex-Europe minister. Her pithy defiance exposed the humbug - and class betrayal - of the metropolitan Momentum bourgeoisie.

Caroline Flintwas a lonely figure on the upper benches of the Commons on Saturday as she defied both the Labour whip and audible murmurs of opprobrium. But somebody from the great party of Keir Hardie and the workers’ struggle had to say it.

Her specific point was that EU single market law forces local authorities to outsource contracts to EU firms against local interest. It has fed the zero-hours epidemic. Transnational capital can exploit the EU ‘posted workers’ directive and labour arbitrage...
description: “When it comes to workers' rights, the EU is not God,” dared blaspheme Labour's ex-Europe minister.
